page.title: 05INTERVIEWS (Attitudes)
page.content: {Skellingthorpe {Subject:Male (65 years),}resident for 34 years.He thought it a pleasant place to live for those who like the relative quiet of a village. There were many{clubs and activities}for the elderly,a youth club,Scouts & Guides and several sports' clubs.There was a playing field,a Library,two pubs,several shops and a Post Office. He disliked the{poor bus service}to Lincoln,the lack of mains gas for half the village and the{flatness of the {scenery. {Subject:Male (38 years),}resident for 15 years.He thought it a pleasant, {friendly place.}The playing field behind his house was a source of noise and nuisance but there was plenty for a sporting person to do. {Subject:Male (14 years).}There is not enough for the young to do.
